text: Paul Murphy (1942/1943 â€“ 20 October 2020) was an Australian political journalist and radio and television presenter. He presented the ABC's afternoon radio current affairs program PM from 1983 to 1993.40th Anniversary of ABC PM program Murphy was a regular guest on This Sporting Life. He was the first host of the SBS-TV current affairs program Dateline, and presented the program for a decade. In the 1994 Australia Day Honours Murphy was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) for "service to public broadcasting and to journalism". Murphy died from cancer on 20 October 2020, aged 77. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Australian journalists Category:Australian television presenters Category:Television news anchors Category:Cancer deaths in Australia
title: Paul Murphy (Australian journalist)
